Coronavirus disease 2019 in children contributed slightly to the collapse of the health care system experienced in the early months of the pandemic.
3 In the paediatric population, the hospitalization rate and the incidence of complications due to SARS-CoV-2 infection is lower compared to other infectious pathogens
4 and to SARS-CoV-2 infection in other age groups.
5 Nevertheless, paediatricians have faced a broad spectrum of presentations, including particularly severe forms of disease often found in patients with underlying conditions.
6 An additional challenge due to the novelty of the disease is the scarcity of scientific evidence on the management of severe forms of disease in the paediatric population, which may have been influenced by the evidence on the management of adult patients.
